javadoc:
ProgramContextMergeManager merges register value changes for multi-user program versions. It merges changes for each named register in the program.
Note: If a register gets changed that is part of another register that has been set, then each named register will get merged independently. This means that when in conflict with another version the conflict would arise for each instead of just the larger register.

methods.name: <init>

params.name: resultPgm
params.comment:
the program to be updated with the result of the merge.
 This is the program that will actually get checked in.

params.name: originalPgm
params.comment: the program that was checked out.

params.name: latestPgm
params.comment: the latest checked-in version of the program.

params.name: myPgm
params.comment: the program requesting to be checked in.

params.name: latestChanges
params.comment: the address set of changes between original and latest versioned program.

params.name: myChanges
params.comment: the address set of changes between original and my modified program.

methods.javadoc:
Sets up the change address sets, Diffs between the various program versions,
 and Merges from various versions to the resulting program.
methods.name: initMergeInfo
methods.comment:
Sets up the change address sets, Diffs between the various program versions,
 and Merges from various versions to the resulting program.

methods.javadoc:
For JUnit testing only, set the option for resolving a conflict.
@param decision ASK_USER, PICK_LATEST, PICK_MY, or PICK_ORIGINAL
methods.name: setConflictDecision
methods.comment: For JUnit testing only, set the option for resolving a conflict.

name: ProgramContextMergeManager
comment:
ProgramContextMergeManager merges register value changes 
 for multi-user program versions. It merges changes for each named register
 in the program.
 Note: If a register gets changed that is part of another register that has been set, 
 then each named register will get merged independently. This means that 
 when in conflict with another version the conflict would arise for each 
 instead of just the larger register.
